definition: to remember
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Remember what we read from I Cor 15?
sentences.chinese: 记得我们在哥林多前书15章所读过的吗？

sentences.english: Maybe some newsy remembers an odd customer.
sentences.chinese: 也许哪个卖报的还记得这么个古怪的顾客。

sentences.english: Or maybe I don't even remember that I was alive.
sentences.chinese: 甚至可能连活着都不记得。

sentences.english: Keep in mind that Drone Platforms don't supply Assimilators when sold.
sentences.chinese: 时刻记得机械平台在卖掉得时候不提供同化者。

sentences.english: Remember to spend a day in Central Park watching a play by Shakespeare in the open air.
sentences.chinese: 记得花一天时间在中央公园露天看莎士比亚的戏剧。

sentences.english: She remembered that she was wearing a moon-white tunic.
sentences.chinese: 她记得她穿的是一件月白的衫子。

sentences.english: Have you only remembered Dong Ying and Tong?
sentences.chinese: 难道你只记得董颖和彤了吗？

sentences.english: Be on time to meetings-early if you can.
sentences.chinese: 开会记得准时，能早点到更好。

sentences.english: Dear colleagues, a pleasant journey, I remember thinking of us, always come back together sometime.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的同事，一路顺风，记得想念我们，常回来聚聚。

sentences.english: I remember when I went and I had a great time.
sentences.chinese: 我记得我读大学的时候度过了一段美妙的时光。

sentences.english: I remember it only had winter cabbages, right?
sentences.chinese: 我记得只有冬储大白菜，对吧？

sentences.english: But remember this auspicious month comes but once a year.
sentences.chinese: 但要记得，吉庆的斋月，每年只有一次。

sentences.english: Fare well, Ai Iijima, I'll remember your love forever.
sentences.chinese: 永别了，饭岛爱，我永远会记得妳的爱。

sentences.english: But he said you remember the week that rained?
sentences.chinese: 他却问我，你记得那个下雨的周末吗？

sentences.english: I didn't recall talking about sneakers, but it was possible, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我没有记得说过软底鞋，但它是可能的，我猜。

sentences.english: We still remember last year, when the first scene scarf to wear it?
sentences.chinese: 还记得我们上一年级时，第一次戴上领巾时的情景吗？

definition: to forget
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
oh (interjection indicating doubt or surprise)
to chant
to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
Oh! (interjection indicating slight surprise)
Oh!
time/length of time/moment/period
at that time
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
I/me/my
then/at that time/in those days
(onom.) smack!
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to recall/to recollect
I see/oh
(particle) marker of surprise, sudden realization, reminder
